USB Mass Storage Class functions for AVR XMEGA Device

Function Documentation

void processBulkOutTransaction ( void   )

Response to EP1_OUT_DATA USB event.
Gets bulk transaction CBW, parses and performs command, sends bulk transaction CSW, and handles communication errors.
Returns when communication is complete.

void processBusReset ( void   )

Response to BUS_RESET USB event.
Any initialization of the mass-storage class should take place here

void processSetupPacket ( void   )

Response to SETUP_PACKET_AVAILABLE USB event.
Get USB setup packet, parse, and process accordingly.
Function returns when processing/communication is complete.

uint8_t readBulkOut ( uint8_t *  buffer )

Reads from bulk out endpoint as part of a bulk data transaction.
Number of bytes read is internally guarded and blkx.xferError is set to 1 if more bytes have been received than were specified to be available in bulk transfer setup packet.
Function tracks number of bytes read over multiple function calls for the purpose of error tracking, but returns only the number of bytes read in each particular function call.

Parameters:
bufferPointer to buffer to read into.
Returns:
Returns number of bytes successfully read.
uint8_t writeBulkIn ( uint8_t *  buffer,
uint8_t  length 
)

Writes to bulk in endpoint as part of a bulk data transaction.
Number of bytes sent is internally guarded so as not to exceed maximum specified in bulk transaction setup packet. If an attempt is made to send more bytes than requested by host, bulkx.xferError is set to 1 and write is not performed. Function tracks total bytes sent over numerous function calls.

Parameters:
bufferPointer to buffer to write from.
lengthNumber of bytes to write.
Returns:
Returns 0 on success, 1 on error.
uint8_t writeBulkIn_P ( prog_uint8_t *  buffer,
uint8_t  length 
)

Same functionality as writeBulkIn() but utilizing buffer in program memory instead of SRAM.

Parameters:
bufferPointer to program memory buffer to write from.
lengthNumber of bytes to write.
Returns:
Returns 0 on success, 1 on error.
